text: [Music]
[Applause]
in this video you'll see how to manage
licenses across multiple AWS accounts
with AWS license manager in license
manager you can link all your accounts
that you manage with AWS organizations
share license configurations among
member accounts and search resources
across multiple accounts at once to get
started you'll need to enable license
manager to manage multiple accounts for
the purposes of this example license
manager is already configured and
managing licenses for this AWS account
let's review the current configuration
here you can see the license
configurations that have already been
created in this account such as the
status license type and number of
licenses consumed from the settings
screen you can enable license manager to
manage licenses for multiple accounts
the first step is to link license
manager to an AWS organizations account
before proceeding let's review the
current organization for our purposes an
organization has already been created
this account is the master account and
you also have one member account in this
organization from here you can easily
add more accounts to the organization
select the invite account option and
then type in the email address or ID of
the account to invite
once the account has accepted the
invitation you'll see it listed as
accepted
there are now two member accounts in
this organization
let's proceed with linking license
manager to the AWS organization
let's also enable cross account
inventory search this will help us find
and discover resources and all the
member accounts of this organization
check the I understand box and apply the
settings
this process may take a minute or two to
complete
we have now successfully configured
license manager for cross account
resource discovery let's navigate to the
search inventory screen to test it out
notice that resources from multiple
accounts are now being displayed
you can view all resources for an
individual account by filtering the
search
once you have identified resources in
the member accounts you can easily
associate a resource with a license
configuration to begin tracking it in
license manager
select the license configuration you
want to associate this resource with
in this case select sequel server
standard
since this resource is in a member
account let's check this box to share
the license configuration with all the
member accounts in the organization
now make the association
next let's review the license
configurations
as you can see the resource we just
created an association for is now listed
let's run another inventory search
over time the resources running on your
accounts will likely change and you'll
want to periodically review them for new
licenses that need to be managed here is
a new resource that wasn't shown last
time let's associate it with a license
configuration as well
in this case the association was blocked
because the license count limit has been
reached if this happens you might need
to purchase an additional license for
that software product or determine
whether that resource should be
decommissioned you can also search by
application name which allows you to
search deep into the data collected by
AWS Systems Manager inventory collection
notice that results are shown for a
specific software product from multiple
accounts now let's review the license
manager dashboard
this dashboard aggregates your data from
across your accounts providing you with
a visual overview of your license
configurations
you've just seen how to manage licenses
across multiple AWS accounts with AWS
license manager thanks for watching now
it's your turn to try
